com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.emx.security

Class KeyStoreManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.adapter.emx.security.KeyStoreManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EMXSigner.CertificateManager

    public final class KeyStoreManager
extends Object
implements EMXSigner.CertificateManager
    A class to manage an EMX KeyStore.

    The KeyStore is a JKS file or (if its file extension is ".pfx" or ".p12") a PKCS#12 file. Certificate and Private Key files can be exported from Internet Explorer and used without modification by the EMX Integrator software.

    The TrustStore is a JKS file or (if its file extension is ".cer") a DER-encoded certificate file (such as downloaded from a security provider).

    Author:
    Christopher J Burton, 25/Nov/2001, modified 20/Sep/2011.

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyStoreManager

        public KeyStoreManager(String compID)
        Allow the user to specify that default keystore and truststore files will be used.

        Because, during development, we may want to be running more than one EMX connection from a single machine, we need to name our KeyStore in such a way that each instance can be held in a separate file. We do this by defaulting to $HOME/emx/security/$CompID.keystore.

        NB: The KeyStoreManager must be initialised before is is used. See initialize().

        Parameters:
        compID - compID

      • KeyStoreManager

        public KeyStoreManager(String keyStoreName,
                       String trustStoreName)
        Allow the user to specify the key store and trust store files explicitly, if he desires.

        NB: The KeyStoreManager must be initialised before is is used. See initialize().

        Parameters:
        keyStoreName - name of the key store
        trustStoreName - name of the trust store

      • KeyStoreManager

        public KeyStoreManager()
        Create a KeyStoreManager for which the parameters will be read from the system properties, if present. Alternative values can be supplied using setter methods. The parameters must be specified between creating the KeyStoreManager and initialising it.

        NB: The KeyStoreManager must be initialised before is is used. See initialize().

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static KeyStoreManager getInstance(IConnectionPoint connectionPoint)
        We will have a singleton class-level getInstance method that will return a common instance of a KeyStoreManager, creating it if necessary, for any supplied ConnectionPoint. This is provided for use by the various Application Server adapters that an EMX connection will require. It allows a common instance to be used, rather than having to create several identical instances.
        Parameters:
        connectionPoint - connection point
        Returns:
        a common instance of a KeyStoreManager

      • setKeyStore

        public void setKeyStore(String keyStore)
        Allow the user to specify the key store. This method is to be used when the KeyStoreManager has been created with a null constructor.

        Call this method before calling initialize().

        Parameters:
        keyStore - the key store

      • setTrustStore

        public void setTrustStore(String trustStore)
        Allow the user to specify the trust store. This method is to be used when the KeyStoreManager has been created with a null constructor.

        Call this method before calling initialize().

        Parameters:
        trustStore - the trust store

      • setKeyStorePassword

        public void setKeyStorePassword(String password)
        Allow the user to specify a password for the key store. If none is specified a (rather insecure) default of "password" is assumed.

        Call this method before calling initialize().

        Parameters:
        password - a password

      • setTrustStorePassword

        public void setTrustStorePassword(String password)
        Allow the user to specify a password for the trust store. If none is specified a (rather insecure) default of "password" is assumed.

        Call this method before calling initialize().

        Parameters:
        password - a password

      • setKeyPassword

        public void setKeyPassword(String password)
        Allow the user to specify a password for the private key. If none is specified a (rather insecure) default of "password" is assumed.

        Call this method before calling initialize().

        Parameters:
        password - a password

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws FileNotFoundException,
                       IOException
        Open and read the keystore and truststore.

        This method must be called by the client before the KeyStore can be used, or otherwise a NullPointerException will be thrown when an attempt is made to sign or verify a message.

        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the specified key store does not exist.
        IOException - if the specified key store is not in the correct format.

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Returns:
        whether this KeyStoreManager has been initialized.

      • getErrorAccessingFileName

        public String getErrorAccessingFileName()
        If an error occurred accessing a file, return the file name.
        Returns:
        the file name or null

      • configureSSLSocketConnection

        @Deprecated
public void configureSSLSocketConnection()
        Deprecated. There is no need to call this method, which will be removed in a future version.
        This method no longer performs any action.

      • sign

        public void sign(EMXMessage message)
          throws EMXSigner.MessageFormatException
        Sign a EMXMessage using our PrivateKey and Certificate.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to sign
        Throws:
        EMXSigner.MessageFormatException - If the supplied message is corrupt or cannot be parsed for any other reason.

      • verify

        public void verify(EMXMessage message)
            throws EMXSigner.CertificateNotFoundException,
                   EMXSigner.MessageFormatException,
                   EMXSigner.VerifyFailureException
        Verify a EMXMessage. An exception will be thrown if there's a problem.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to verify
        Throws:
        EMXSigner.MessageFormatException - If the supplied message is corrupt or cannot be parsed for any other reason.
        EMXSigner.CertificateNotFoundException - If no certificate that matches the IssuerDN and SerialNumber exists in the truststore.
        EMXSigner.VerifyFailureException - If the supplied message was not signed by the certificate used for the verify.

      • getPrivateKey

        public PrivateKey getPrivateKey()
        Returns:
        our PrivateKey. We assume there is only one key entry in the KeyStore.

      • getCertificate

        public X509Certificate getCertificate()
        Returns:
        the Certificate that supports our PrivateKey. We assume there is only one key entry in the KeyStore.

        See getCertificate(String,BigInteger) for a method to get the certificate indicated by an issuer and serial number.

      • getStoreType

        public static String getStoreType(String filename)
        Determine the key store type from the file extension. If the file type is ".pfx" or ".p12" then we assume it is"pkcs12", otherwise we assume it is "jks". Note that if the file type is ".cer" we will return "jks". In that case, the calling program MUST load the certificate into a JKS store - it will not be done automatically.
        Parameters:
        filename - the store's file name
        Returns:
        the key store type

      • getCertificate

        public X509Certificate getCertificate(String issuerDN,
                                      BigInteger serialNumber)
                               throws EMXSigner.CertificateNotFoundException
        Implement the EMXSigner.CertificateManager interface, to return the Certificate that is to be used for verifying a signature.

        We look in the truststore for the certificate indicated by the supplied issuerDN and serialNumber.

        Specified by:
        getCertificate in interface EMXSigner.CertificateManager
        Throws:
        EMXSigner.CertificateNotFoundException
